  "evidence": [
    "when you push a volume of air in one direction and then release it, the molecules move back and forth along that same line.",
    "This back-and-forth motion produces a longitudinal wave, where regions of compression and rarefaction travel in the same direction as the wave.",
    "That’s what we call a P-wave, or pressure wave.",
    "In ultrasound, this is the type of wave we use — the longitudinal wave traveling through soft tissue.",
